author: Special Correspondent
text:
DMK leader M. Karunanidhi on Friday said the manifesto of the party for the 2016 Assembly polls would be released in a few days.

Talking to reporters, he said Namakku Naamey programme of party treasurer M.K. Stalin would have given him a first hand account of the problems of the poor and the experience would come in handy while serving the people.

He requested government employees and teachers to give up their protest and report for duty. “Continuing the protest will not help as the government is unlikely to consider their demand,” he said.
title: DMK manifesto in a few days
